bill_title: prohibit the discharge of firearms under certain conditions and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the discharge of firearms under certain conditions and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may discharge or shoot, from private property, any firearm or dangerous weapon, as defined in § 22-1-2, within six hundred sixty feet of any occupied dwelling or any livestock without the written permission of the owner of the land on which the dwelling or livestock are located. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
